001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004
005/**
006 * An interface for point hashes that are statistically biased, as well as a holder for inner classes that implement
007 * this. The point hashes here are mostly chosen because they are aesthetically interesting, at least on some of their
008 * output bits.
009 * <br>
010 * Don't count on this class giving reliable output; it is marked Beta and will remain so. If you want to ensure a
011 * particular behavior of a FlawedPointHash can be replicated, copy the implementation into your own code.
012 * <br>
013 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/14/2020.
014 */
015@Beta
016public interface FlawedPointHash extends IPointHash, IFlawed {
017    /**
018     * Produces hashes that show strong bias on one axis (usually the later axes matter more) and have nice-looking
019     * patterns of dots. Better patterns are present in the higher bits.
020     */
021    class RugHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
022        public RugHash() {
023        }
024
025        public RugHash(long state) {
026            super(state);
027        }
028
029        public long getState() {
030            return state;
031        }
032
033        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
034            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
035            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
036            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
037            return (int) (s >>> 32);
038        }
039
040        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
041            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
042            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
043            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
044            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
045            return (int) (s >>> 32);
046        }
047
048        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
049            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + w);
050            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
051            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
052            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
053            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (w + z);
054            return (int) (s >>> 32);
055        }
056
057        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long s) {
058            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + u);
059            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
060            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
061            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
062            u = (u + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ u) * (w + z);
063            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (u + w);
064            return (int) (s >>> 32);
065        }
066
067        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
068            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + v);
069            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
070            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
071            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
072            u = (u + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ u) * (w + z);
073            v = (v + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ v) * (u + w);
074            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (v + u);
075            return (int) (s >>> 32);
076        }
077
078        @Override
079        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
080            return hashLongs(x, y, state);
081        }
082
083        @Override
084        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
085            return hashLongs(x, y, z, state);
086        }
087
088        @Override
089        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
090            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state);
091        }
092
093        @Override
094        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
095            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, state);
096        }
097
098        @Override
099        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
100            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state);
101        }
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Extremely flawed if you're using this as a point hash, but meant to be aesthetically interesting, this produces
106     * different symmetrical patterns in squares, as if on a quilt.
107     */
108    class QuiltHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
109        private int size = 6;
110        private long mask = (1L << size) - 1L;
111        public QuiltHash() {
112        }
113
114        public QuiltHash(long state) {
115            super(state);
116        }
117
118        public QuiltHash(long state, int size) {
119            super(state);
120            setSize(size);
121        }
122
123        public long getState() {
124            return state;
125        }
126
127        public int getSize() {
128            return 1 << size;
129        }
130
131        public void setSize(int size) {
132            this.size = 32 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(Math.max(1, size));
133            mask = (1L << this.size) - 1L;
134        }
135
136        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
137            s ^= (x >> size) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
138            s ^= (y >> size) * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL;
139            x *= x;
140            y *= y;
141            x = x >>> 1 & mask;
142            y = y >>> 1 & mask;
143            long t;
144            if (x < y) {
145                t = x;
146                x = y;
147                y = t;
148            }
149            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
150            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
151            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
152            return s;
153        }
154
155        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
156            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, z, s), s);
157//            s ^= (x >> size) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
158//            s ^= (y >> size) * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
159//            s ^= (z >> size) * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
160//            x *= x;
161//            y *= y;
162//            z *= z;
163//            x &= mask;
164//            y &= mask;
165//            z &= mask;
166//            long t;
167//            if (x < y && z < y) {
168//                t = x;
169//                x = y;
170//                y = t;
171//            }
172//            else if(x < y && y < z){
173//                t = x;
174//                x = z;
175//                z = t;
176//            }
177//            else if(y < x && x < z){
178//                t = y;
179//                y = z;
180//                z = t;
181//            }
182//            else if(y < x && z < x){
183//                t = y;
184//                y = z;
185//                z = t;
186//            }
187//
188//            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
189//            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
190//            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
191//            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
192//            return (int) (s >>> 32);
193        }
194
195        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
196            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, w, s), s), s);
197        }
198
199        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long s) {
200            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, u, s), s), s), s);
201        }
202        
203        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
204            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, hashLongs(u, v, s), s), s), s), s);
205        }
206
207        @Override
208        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
209            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, state) >>> 32);
210        }
211
212        @Override
213        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
214            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, state) >>> 32);
215        }
216
217        @Override
218        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
219            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state) >>> 32);
220        }
221
222        @Override
223        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
224            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, state) >>> 32);
225        }
226        
227        @Override
228        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
229            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state) >>> 32);
230        }
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Very similar to {@link QuiltHash}, but this doesn't change the pattern in different large squares, and instead
235     * repeats a square or cube of symmetric and patterned results over and over (so it can be tiled).
236     */
237    class CubeHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
238        private int size = 6;
239        private long mask = (1L << size) - 1L;
240        public CubeHash() {
241        }
242
243        public CubeHash(long state) {
244            super(state);
245        }
246
247        public CubeHash(long state, int size) {
248            super(state);
249            setSize(size);
250        }
251
252        public long getState() {
253            return state;
254        }
255
256        public int getSize() {
257            return 1 << size;
258        }
259
260        public void setSize(int size) {
261            this.size = 32 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(Math.max(1, size));
262            mask = (1L << this.size) - 1L;
263        }
264
265        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
266            x &= mask;
267            y &= mask;
268            x *= x * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
269            y *= y * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL;
270            x &= mask;
271            y &= mask;
272            long t;
273            if (x < y) {
274                t = x;
275                x = y;
276                y = t;
277            }
278            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
279            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
280            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
281            return s;
282        }
283
284        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
285            x &= mask;
286            y &= mask;
287            z &= mask;
288//            s ^= (x) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
289//            s ^= (y) * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
290//            s ^= (z) * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
291            x *= x * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
292            y *= y * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
293            z *= z * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
294            x = x & mask;
295            y = y & mask;
296            z = z & mask;
297            long t;
298            if (x < y) {
299                t = x;
300                x = y;
301                y = t;
302            }
303            if(x < z){
304                t = x;
305                x = z;
306                z = t;
307            }
308            if(y < z){
309                t = y;
310                y = z;
311                z = t;
312            }
313            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
314            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
315            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
316            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
317            return s;
318        }
319
320        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
321            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, w, s), s), s);
322        }
323
324        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long s) {
325            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, u, s), s), s), s);
326        }
327
328        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
329            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, hashLongs(u, v, s), s), s), s), s);
330        }
331
332        @Override
333        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
334            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, state) >>> 32);
335        }
336
337        @Override
338        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
339            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, state) >>> 32);
340        }
341
342        @Override
343        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
344            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state) >>> 32);
345        }
346
347        @Override
348        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
349            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, state) >>> 32);
350        }
351
352        @Override
353        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
354            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state) >>> 32);
355        }
356    }
357
358    /**
359     * FNV32a is OK as a hash for bytes when used in some hash tables, but it has major issues on its low-order bits
360     * when used as a point hash (the high bits aren't much better). Unfortunately, it is not aesthetically pleasing as
361     * a point hash. Some usages might be able to use it to apply a grimy, glitchy effect.
362     */
363    class FNVHash extends IntImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
364
365        public FNVHash() {
366            super();
367        }
368
369        public FNVHash(int state) {
370            super(state);
371        }
372
373        public int getState() {
374            return state;
375        }
376        @Override
377        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
378            return ((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193;
379        }
380
381        @Override
382        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
383            return (((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193;
384        }
385
386        @Override
387        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
388            return ((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193 ^ w) * 0x1000193;
389        }
390
391        @Override
392        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
393            return (((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193
394                    ^ w) * 0x1000193 ^ u) * 0x1000193;
395        }
396
397        @Override
398        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
399            return ((((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193
400                    ^ w) * 0x1000193 ^ u) * 0x1000193 ^ v) * 0x1000193;
401        }
402    }
403}
